column4: Okay, I'm sure this question has been asked a million times today, but has the broken xserver update been pulled?
a newer (fixed) version is out
k7
I thought so.  Will I notice any real difference?
why would you want a BTclient that supports rss feeds? why not a rss reader and a btclient?
Well, I suppose I can go that route.  I was just looking to combine the two.  Revision3 now offers Torrent feeds.  I thought it would make it easier to download the shows I watch on a regular basis.

shrug.  I'm not a torrent person.  Anyway, if you want lightweight torrent clients, there are some built in, with a simple gtk frontend, a curses frontend, and a headless one, at that.  btdownload[tab] [tab]  will show you those options
Thanks.
As far as RSS readers go, which to you suggest?
no idea
haha, Thanks anyway.
#ubuntu+1
they both do it.
server will get you server kernel, and the lamp pre-install.  You may or may not want the server kernel.
Alt. CD has more hardware support

Ahh, okay.  I think the Alt. CD is the way I'll go.  I'm using Debian right now, but I'd like to get Ubuntu installed.  I've got a Compaq Presario 5222 with a 350MHz processor and and 64MB of RAM I'm trying to get up and running.
You'll select the "server" install, instead of the "desktop" install, at the boot menu
Well, I mean, I don't really want the server kernel... I guess I can change it anyway later...
the alt. CD doesn't have the server kernel on it
not google desktop
Oh, why so?
it's not as feature rich as the native linux solutions.
Do you use either Beagle or Tracker?
